tourBios.exmtStatus: Exempt - Next 25 Money Winners from 2015 Web.com Tour Finals
tourBios.curYearHigh: Played in all 25 Web.com Tour events, making 19 cuts, with a runner-up, two top 10s and six top 25s. Finished 38th on the combined Regular Season/Finals' money list...Finished the Web.com Tour season having played all 25 tournaments. Had one runner-up, two top-10s, six top-25s and 19 cuts made. Was 38th on the final combined money list...Made cuts in four of his first seven starts...First top-10 and best finish of the year came in May at the United Leasing Championship at the difficult Victoria National GC. Was solo second through three rounds, four behind Smylie Kaufman. Final-round 74 resulted in a T2 finish, five behind winner Kaufman. It was his career-best finish on Tour and moved him to 24th on the money list... Would make the cut in 11 of his last 13 events, including the last six to finish the Regular Season 38th in earnings...Finished the Regular Season 38th on the money list. Led the Driving Accuracy Percentage stat (76.62) during the Regular Season...In the Web.com Tour Finals, made the first three cuts, with his best finish a T9 at the third event, the Nationwide Children's Hospital Championship...Was T4 at the halfway point of the Small Business Connection Championship at River Run, the second Finals' event, but was derailed by a 75-74 finish on the weekend, resulting in a T30...Entered the Web.com Tour Championship 21st on the Finals' money list only to miss the cut by four shots, which would bump him seven spots down the list to No. 28. Finished $927 behind Rob Oppenheim at No. 25. At season's end, was No. 1 in Driving Accuracy (74.33 percent).
tourBios.carHigh:
2014: Finished T16 at Web.com Tour Qualifying Tournament in December. Closed with a 67 to jump from T40 and improve his status considerably...Played in 20 Web.com Tour events, recording one top-10 and four top-25s. Made 10 cuts. Finished 80th on the money list...Top-10 came at Price Cutter Charity Championship in August after three missed cuts in a row. A third-round 63 propelled him to a T6, two shots off winner Cameron Percy's 21-under-par pace...Competed hard over the last three weeks in an attempt to make the Web.com Tour Finals with finishes of T6 (Springfield, Mo.), T22 (Knoxville) and T26 (Portland) to improve from 113th to 80th, only to come up five shy of the mark.

2013: Made the cut in 13 of 23 starts during his rookie season on the Web.com Tour and had one top-10 finish. In his second start of the season he ran off a tournament-record six birdies in a row during the second round of the Colombia Championship. Started his streak at No. 14 and continued it as he made the turn to the front nine. Saved par from 12 feet at No. 2 and then added another birdie at No. 3, giving him eight consecutive one-putt greens. Was tied for fifth headed into the final round but stumbled with a 3-over 74 and dropped to T19…Was 11th the following week at the Chile Classic…Earned his first career top-10 finish with a T5 at the South Georgia Classic. Opened with a bogey-free, 6-under 66 to take the first-round lead at Kinderlou Forest GC…Posted two more Regular Season top 20s at the Rex Hospital Open (T13) and Utah Championship (T18). Made the cut in two of four Finals events with a T11 at the Hotel Fitness Championship his best effort. 

2012: Missed the cut at the Midwest Classic after gaining entry as a Monday qualifier. 

2011: Was T66 at the Children's Hospital Classic, where he received a sponsor exemption into the field...Was named the Hooters Tour Rookie of the Year. 

2009: Qualified for the U.S. Open at Bethpage State Park to get his first PGA TOUR start but missed the cut.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Four-time All-Missouri Valley Conference golfer...Won the 2006 MVC championship...Member of the 2008 U.S.-Japan Cup team...Second-team All-American in 2008...MVC Conference Player of the Year in 2008.
tourBios.personal: Has worked as a transporter at an Autocraft store in Wichita since college...If he were not a golfer, would want to be a comedian or actor...Always gets rid of his ball after a bogey...Is an Oklahoma City Thunder fan...Loves playing video games...Supports the Salvation Army...Twitter account is @Spearzy_golf34.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the Web.com Tour in 2016 is T22nd at the Brasil Champions presented by Embrase.
dyn.dynStats: He ranks T82nd in Scoring Average (Actual) on the Web.com Tour.
